verb.description: Separate or release (someone or something) from something to which they are attached or connected.
examples: I disengaged his hand from mine
they clung together for a moment, then she disengaged herself

verb.description: Remove (troops) from an area of conflict.
examples: the ceasefire gave the commanders a chance to disengage their forces
his true intent is to disengage from the messy conflict

verb.description: Pass the point of one's sword over or under the opponent's sword to change the line of attack.
